quiz2.questionText:
This is used to find the length of
a Java ArrayList.
quiz2.explanation:
The .size() method is used to
determine the length of Java ArrayLists; .length is used
for Arrays.

Do-while, white, and for loops are all
valid in Java; if STATEMENTS are not loops.

CSS stands for Cascading Style
Sheet.

quiz2.questionText:
HTML determines the content of
a webpage.
quiz2.explanation:
HTML DOES outline the content of a
webpage - CSS styles it, and JS adds functionality.

1024 bits is equal to 128 bytes.
(There are 8 bits in each byte)

quiz2.questionText:
Select the command line/terminal
command that allows you to navigate up one directory.
quiz2.explanation:
cd .. is the command used to
navigate up one directory. The others are valid commands
but have other uses.

quiz2.questionText:
Select all valid methods of tree
traversal.
quiz2.explanation:
Reorder is not a form of tree traversal;
the 3 others are all valid.

quiz2.questionText:
Which of these is referred to as
the 'brain' of the computer?
quiz2.explanation:
As the 'brain of the computer', the
CPU retreives & executes instructions.

quiz2.questionText:
The SQL COMBINE clause is used
to combine tables based on a shared column.
quiz2.explanation:
The JOIN clause is what's used to
combine tables based on a shared column.

Alan Turing is credited with designing
the machine that broke Enigma.

Speakers & monitors are output
devices, while keyboards & mice are input devices.

DOM stands for Document Object
Model.

quiz2.questionText:
This animal shares it's name with
a Python module used to create vector graphics.
quiz2.explanation:
Turtle is the name of the Python
module used as a drawingboard to create graphics.

quiz2.questionText: Flexbox is a CSS layout model.
quiz2.explanation:
The Flexible Box Model (aka. Flexbox)
IS a CSS layout model.

quiz2.questionText:
How many iterations are there to
this Java for loop? : for(int i = 1; i < 20; i++){...}
quiz2.explanation:
If this loop went from i = 0 to i < 20 it
would have 20 iterations; it instead starts at 1, so there
are 19.

quiz2.questionText:
== can be used to compare the
content of Java Strings for equality.
quiz2.explanation:
Java Strings should NOT be
compared using ==, but by using .equals() intead.

quiz2.questionText:
Which of the following is correct
syntax for printing 'Hello World' in Java?
quiz2.explanation:
The correct syntax for this Java print
statement is: System.out.println('Hello World');

Java is NOT short for Javascript. The
two languages are completely different.

quiz2.questionText:
Check all valid Java variable
names.
quiz2.explanation:
Variable names cannot start with
numbers; therefore, all of the chocies are valid except for
1myName.

RDBS stands for Relational Database
Management System.
